Created attachment 8970173
rec of the issue.gif

[Affected Versions]:
- Firefox 43
- Firefox 45 ESR
- Firefox 46
- Firefox 52 ESR
- Firefox 56

[Affected Platforms]:
- All Windows
- All Linux
- All Mac

[Prerequisites]:
- Have a new Firefox profile.
- Have the following prefs. in the "about:config" page (If a preference does not exist, please create it):
	- “xpinstall.signatures.required” pref set to “false”;
	- “browser.search.countryCode” pref set to "US".
- Have the latest "Google Code Correction" add-on (1.0) installed from https://goo.gl/P2KVst.

[Steps to reproduce]:
1. Open the browser with the profile from prerequisites and navigate to the "about:support" page.
2. Select the "Restart with Add-ons Disabled..." option and click the "Restart" button.
4. Click the "Start in Safe Mode: button and focus the "Search Bar".
5. Write any word and press the "Enter" key.
6. Observe the URL.

[Expected result]:
- The URL contains the "firefox-b-1" string.

[Actual result]:
- The URL does not contains the "firefox-b-1" string.

[Notes]:
- We are not sure how close this scenario is by the behavior of a system add-on. However disabling the add-on when the browser is not is the "Safe Mode" will keep generating the "firefox-b-1" string when searches are made.
- The issue is reproducible with the non-US builds.
- Attached a screen recording of the issue.
comments.author: mcoman@mozilla.com
comments.creator: mcoman@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text:
Restarting with addons disabled does appear to disable system addons that were not bundled with the browser.

So this is working as designed, but probably deserves a separate bug.
